text: Comparative analysis identifies conserved <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factor 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding sites in the human and simian Epstein-Barr virus oncogene <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Nonhuman primates are naturally infected with a B-lymphotropic herpesvirus closely related to Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) .
These simian EBV share considerable genetic , biologic , and epidemiologic features with human EBV , including virus - induced tumorigenesis .
However , latent , transformation - associated viral genes demonstrate marked sequence divergence among species despite the conserved functions .

We have cloned the <extra_id_0> latent membrane protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) homologs from the simian EBV naturally infecting baboons ( cercopithicine herpesvirus 12 , herpesvirus papio ) and rhesus monkeys ( cercopithicine herpesvirus 15 ) for a comparative study with the human EBV oncogene .

The transmembrane domains are well conserved , but there is striking sequence divergence of the carboxy-terminal cytoplasmic domain essential for B-cell immortalization and interaction with the tumor necrosis factor receptor signaling pathway .

Nevertheless , the simian EBV <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> s retain most functions in common with EBV <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , including the ability to induce NF - ( kappa ) B activity in human cells , to bind the <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-associated factor 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in vitro , and to induce expression of tumor necrosis factor - responsive genes , such as <extra_id_0> ICAM1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in human B lymphocytes .

Multiple <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding sites containing a PXQXT / S core sequence can be identified in the simian EBV <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> s by an in vitro binding assay .

A PXQXT / S - containing sequence is also present in the cytoplasmic domain of the Hodgkin 's disease marker , <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and binds <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vitro .

The last 13 amino acids containing a PXQXT / S sequence are highly conserved in human and simian EBV <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but do not bind <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting a distinct role for this conserved region of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The conserved <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding sites in <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Hodgkin 's disease marker provides further evidence that a <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated signal transduction pathway may be important in malignant transformation .
